title: Kings bring in veteran goalie
text:
Kings bring in veteran goalie By: Uncredited 
The Manitoba Junior Hockey League’s Dauphin Kings have swapped 20-year-olds with B.C.’s Merritt Centennials on Monday. 
The Kings added goalie Jarrod Schamerhorn, sending Ryan Coghlan back out west. 
Coghlan, who did not play with the Kings this season, split last year between the Western Hockey League’s Prince Albert Raiders and Saskatoon Blades, as well as the Nanaimo Clippers of the British Columbia Hockey League. Schamerhorn started this season 1-3 with a 3.73 goals-against average and a .902 save percentage for the Vernon Vipers and was traded to the Centennials before being flipped to Dauphin. 
In another MJHL move, the Portage Terriers have picked up 20-year-old forward Braydon MacDonald and future considerations from the Saskatchewan Junior Hockey League’s Melfort Mustangs for forward Tyler Jeanson, 18. 
MacDonald had one goal in five games with the Mustangs. Jeanson had 54 points in 56 games last season and helped Portage win the Canadian junior A championship.
